{"doc":{"info":{"calaisRequestID":"34971973-9d65-dea2-146f-22febbe46620","id":"http://id.opencalais.com/saL3JkiiFPzb5n8XAtIQEA","docId":"http://d.opencalais.com/dochash-1/2e0a7b77-8ff9-3a9a-aeef-5122112f3c0c","document":" ￼Caspar 70-96 6/7/94 5:24 pm Page 96 David Constantine was born in 1944 in Salford, Lancashire. He read Modern Languages at Wadham College, Oxford, and from 1969 to 1981 was a lecturer in German at Durham University. He is now Fellow in German at the Queen\u2019s College, Oxford. He is married with two children, and lives in Oxford. His first book of poems, A Brightness to Cast Shadows (Bloodaxe Books, 1980), was widely acclaimed. His second collection, Watching for Dolphins (Bloodaxe Books, 1983), won the 1984 Alice Hunt Bart  lett Prize, and his academic study, Early Greek Travellers and the Hellenic Ideal (Cambridge University Press, 1984), won the first Runciman Prize in 1985. His first novel, Davies, was published by Bloodaxe in 1985. His third collection, Madder (Bloodaxe Books, 1987), a Poetry Book Society Recommendation, won the Southern Arts Literature Prize. The French edition of Madder, translated by Yves Bichet as Sorlingues (Editions La Dogana, 1992), won the Somcthfng SonTcthing Prize. His Selected Poems (Bloodaxe Books, 1991) is a Poetry Book Society Recommendation. His latest book is Caspar Hauser: a poem in nine cantos (Bloodaxe Books, 1994). /Vfx His other books include a critical introduction to the poetry of Friedrich Holderlin (Oxford University Press, 1988), a*d- a trans  lation of Holderlin\u2019s Selected Poems (Bloodaxe Books, 1990)^ The Bloodaxe Contemporary French Poets series includes his transla  tions of (with Helen Constantine) Spaced, Displaced by Henri Michaux (1992) and (with Mark Treharne) Under Clouded Skies / Beauregard by Philippe Jaccottet (1994). David: can we-#ekLvour other translatipas'lfhd books, and the French^pfize for MacMer - can send details pleas&? 96 OiAj'kt i cuss.cs,m p ) \u2022 M-s ^-iVre. .y ","docTitle":"","docDate":"1994-06-07"},"meta":{"contentType":"text/raw","emVer":"7.1.1103.5","langIdVer":"DefaultLangId","processingVer":"CalaisJob01","submissionDate":"2014-07-01 08:49:25.310","submitterCode":"57b17a53-6e34-87b0-20ff-a419896f49c9","signature":"digestalg-1|U1GPXEvKAOsDbHNctZm3FqZp62o=|XBEhSXlEeai3gWEVKO/GvorwYQGMFcMRHV+YrwihtCSzFTxZqgsXUA==","language":"English"}},"http://d.opencalais.com/dochash-1/2e0a7b77-8ff9-3a9a-aeef-5122112f3c0c/cat/1":{"_typeGroup":"topics","category":"http://d.opencalais.com/cat/Calais/HumanInterest","classifierName":"Calais","categoryName":"Human Interest","score":0.569},"http://d.opencalais.com/dochash-1/2e0a7b77-8ff9-3a9a-aeef-5122112f3c0c/lid/DefaultLangId":{"_typeGroup":"language","language":"http://d.opencalais.com/lid/DefaultLangId/English"},"http://d.opencalais.com/pershash-1/ac80b4b7-6740-378f-bdc5-61c60bc15d52":{"_typeGroup":"entities","_type":"Person","name":"Philippe Jaccottet","persontype":"N/A","nationality":"N/A","commonname":"Philippe Jaccottet","_typeReference":"http://s.opencalais.com/1/type/em/e/Person","instances":[{"detection":"[Treharne) Under Clouded Skies / Beauregard by ]Philippe Jaccottet[ (1994).
